docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Important human trials of drugs potentially useful in treating AIDS have been delayed for months by technical, ethical and financial problems, bureaucratic sluggishness and lack of cooperation from a major manufacturer, according to experts in AIDS research.

headline.main: EXPERTS FIND LAG ON TESTING DRUGS IN AIDS PATIENTS

docs.snippet: LEAD: Important human trials of drugs potentially useful in treating AIDS have been delayed for months by technical, ethical and financial problems, bureaucratic sluggishness and lack of cooperation from a major manufacturer, according to experts in...

byline.original: By PHILIP M. BOFFEY, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: SCHOOLS across Connecticut have been stepping up efforts to ease the risk of teen-age suicides.
docs.snippet: LEAD: SCHOOLS across Connecticut have been stepping up efforts to ease the risk of teen-age suicides.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Doctors who had never heard of AIDS when they embarked on their careers now find it consuming a widening share of their lives, presenting stresses they never before contemplated.

headline.main: DOCTORS, FIGHTING THE WAR ON AIDS FIND THEY ARE AMONG THE CASUALTIES

docs.snippet: LEAD: Doctors who had never heard of AIDS when they embarked on their careers now find it consuming a widening share of their lives, presenting stresses they never before contemplated.

byline.original: By JUDITH CUMMINGS, Special to The New York Times
